summary: The `temporalio` meta package doesn't work with strict dependency resolution package managers like pnpm and yarn3. The team decided to deprecate it and recommend installing individual packages (@temporalio/client, @temporalio/worker, @temporalio/workflow, @temporalio/activity, @temporalio/common) directly instead.
userImpact: Users of pnpm and yarn3 cannot use the simplified `npm install temporalio` command and must install individual packages instead, creating confusion and inconsistent documentation.
rootCause: Package managers like pnpm and yarn3 enforce strict dependency resolution and don't support transitive dependencies without explicit installation, making the umbrella package non-functional for these users.
proposedFix: Deprecate the `temporalio` meta package and update all setup instructions and samples to recommend installing individual packages: `npm install @temporalio/{client,worker,workflow,activity,common}`
workaround: Install individual packages directly instead of using the meta package, as most utilities are re-exported from relevant client/activity/workflow packages.
resolutionDetails: The meta package was deprecated and documentation was updated to recommend installing individual packages for all users, providing a consistent approach across package managers.
keyQuote: I'd rather steer users in the right direction... it seems like the node ecosystem is going towards the more strict package layout scheme
